responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis is a new position that has come up to support the growing business Water Quality in SEA. This position is responsible for providing HR partnership to the business and will therefore work across a variety of HR topics, ranging from recruitment to probation, performance management, to HR administration.  Indicative list of responsibilities is listed below:  Recruitment: Drive the recruitment process for assigned client groups.  Duties include identification of staffing needs, interviewing, making offers, performing background checks, facilitating relocation and on-boarding of new hires.  Compensation: Manage compensation programs for assigned client groups including annual merit review and incentive programs. Benchmark external salary data for competitiveness and ensure equity across the organization.  Ensure proper system administration of compensation process and records (e.g. grade changes, promotions, salary changes, etc).  Maintain job descriptions and assist managers in writing job descriptions. Employee Relations: Apply conflict management skills to facilitate resolution when associate-to-associate or manager-to-associate conflict arises.  Investigate (interview, gather evidence, consult legal) allegations of employee misconduct including harassment, discrimination, etc.  Guide management on disciplinary and termination procedures.  Engage company attorney for counsel when necessary. Compliance, Policies & Procedures: Work with attorneys as required to ensure legal compliance.  Act as liaison to governmental compliance agencies as required.  Ensure consistent application of policies/procedures including but not limited to recruiting, training, reward & recognition and associate development. Change Management: Challenge the status quo and champion new initiatives within assigned client groups.  Performance Management: Drive the Performance Management process within assigned client groups. Work with managers and associates to identify and address performance related issues. Provide coaching and support to managers on corrective action items including performance improvement plans and discipline issues Reporting & HR Analytics : Monthly reporting on HR activities within the region ( & Asia) , including recruitment, turnover, IFR, TTF.  General Support: Enter employee data into Workday and other relevant systems.  Create and maintain personnel files to ensure legal compliance.  Own payroll process for SEA. Terminations: Perform timely exit interviews and record data to be analyzed for retention purposes.    Talent Development: Drive the talent development process for assigned client groups, consult with and train management to create associate development and succession plans to improve bench strength and achieve Talent Review objectives. Organizational Diagnostics & Development: Understand and analyze organizational capabilities within assigned client groups, proactively develop and implement organizational design and structure improvements to support delivery of the business strategy. Health & Safety: Oversee health, safety & environment requirements for the organization, including but not limited to: compliance with relevant legislation; updating and maintaining HSE policies, procedures, manuals and forms; reporting as required. Other: Duties as assigned

job: Senior Assoc, Audit Digitalization Business Analyst – Data Analytics & Robotics Team, Grp Audit(1800
requirements: Requirements At least 4 years of (cumulative) relevant experience, with tertiary education. Good understanding Corporate / Institutional Banking Group (IBG/GTS) and credit risk knowledge Knowledge of IBG, GTS and RMG related systems, data and processes Ability to write SQL code Business / data analytics, visualisation and dashboard development.  Strong business analyst skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements Independent self-starter with ability to multitask Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts Has a ‘can-do’ attitude
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Function  Group Audit helps the Board and Executive Management meet the strategic and operational objectives of the DBS Group. We conduct independent checks to ensure that the Group’s risk and control processes are adequate and effective. All our team members are highly sought-after professionals who work as trusted advisors to our clients, in all matters related to a company’s internal controls.  This position supports the digitalisation efforts of the IBG audit team.  As such, it requires strong knowledge of IBG, GTS and RMG related systems, data and processes. The candidate will be a major enabler of Audit Digitalisation, understanding auditor requirements and providing digital tools to transform the way audits are carried out.  Digitisation provides the ability to ingest and process voluminous data across different segments in the Bank, and opportunities to glean additional insights via visualisation techniques and data analysis.  Responsibilities   Elicit automation opportunities through interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, task and workflow analysis Maximise automation opportunities by challenging auditors on their assumptions used in test steps Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs Shortlist data required to implement automation specifications and engage stakeholders to obtain access to data sources Communicate and collaborate with auditors to develop automation specifications Serve as the conduit between auditors and the technology teams which manage the underlying bank systems. Project manage the end-to-end process to ensure timely delivery of automation opportunities Identify opportunities to leverage data analytics and visualisation techniques to generate additional insights Have a strong understanding of IBG, GTS and RMG systems, data and processes. The objective is to facilitate integrated data analytics at Portfolio, Borrower, Facility, Product and Transactional levels.  As a team member, this individual supports the delivery of digitalisation initiatives (automation and visualisation solutions).  And in doing so, enhance the department’s ability to provide greater audit assurance and achieve productivity benefits.

You are expected to be proficient in programming language such as Python and R, and work with the research partners to develop simulation and analytics models to enhance the planning, design and maintenance of HDB towns. You will work with a multi-disciplinary team to develop use cases for augmented/ mixed reality applications to enhance HDB’s operations. You will be responsible to identify relevant new research areas, technologies and test-bedding, as well as validating the desired test-bedding outcomes.   Requirements You should possess a degree in Engineering recognised by the Professional Engineers’ Board, and have at least 2 years of experience in the field of IT and analytics. Candidates with relevant skills in analytics such as modelling, probability and regression analysis, spatial configuration analysis and machine learning will be preferred. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg The Deep Learning 2.0 program is a multi-year A*STAR AI program, focused on capturing the next wave of deep learning. The program is focused on: (a) 10x open problems in deep learning algorithmic research thrusts include learning with 10x fewer labeled samples, incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning, online deep learning, and white box deep learning. (b) Next generation hardware for deep learning: we are looking beyond GPUs and TPUs, and reimagining the entire hardware stack for deep learning from algorithms all the way down to silicon (c) New emerging enterprise applications for deep learning: ranging from personalized medicine, finance, health-care, IOT and advanced semiconductor manufacturing We are looking for a senior researcher who is capable of leading advanced AI methods research (beyond the deep learning hype cycle) on one of the following topics, and its applications to several domains  GANs in speech/ vision/ language Bayesian learning, Causal Inference Lifelong learning: from concepts to tasks Knowledge graphs Bottom-up reasoning Innovative ideas to tackle the YouTube8M data set Multimodal Q&A Systems Game theory Optimization techniques Active Deep Learning  The researcher should be able to conceptualize ambitious R&D programs working with other researchers in DL2, raise funding, build teams and execute. The researcher should also be able to attract top students from the region or beyond. The skills should be complementary to the existing knowhow of the existing DL2 unit.

responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg We are looking for strong candidates in the field of Artificial intelligence and deep learning, with an interest in working on both fundamental algorithms in large-scale machine learning or deep learning, and also applying it to practical problems in vertical domains. The position, based within the Program in Artificial Intelligence at 12R, entails working closely with a highly interdisciplinary team of researchers with training from leading universities like MITI Stanford and CMU. Listed below are problems of interest for this engineering position in the Deep Learning 2.0 project: Multimodal Deep Learning: Towards effective learning from heterogeneous data sources Currently, deep learning is applied in various areas such as visual computing, speech recognition, text mining, etc. in each area, the learning model is trained with large amounts of data in isolation. A multimodal learning approach from heterogeneous data sources, including video, speech, text, etc. is necessary to achieve breakthrough in performance.   Unsupervised Deep Learning: Towards 10X fewer labeled samples Labeling large amounts of training data is one of the most time-consuming steps in the deep learning pipeline, and is often not feasible. The aim is to achieve the same performance with 1.0x fewer labeled training samples. This is a strong step in the direction of unsupervised deep learning, where representations are learnt with large amounts of unlabeled unstructured data,   Deep Learning on Embedded Devices: Towards 1.00X smaller models Current deep learning models have 10s of millions of neurons, making it infeasible for deployment on mobile and embedded hardware. The aim is to achieve models that are 100x smaller, with little loss in performance. This capability will also be critical for emerging neuromorphic platforms, where the number of spiking neurons is orders of magnitude smaller than in current state-of-the-art deep learning models.   Online Deep Learning: Towards Near RealTime (NRT) model updates State-of-the-art deep learning models still take several days to train on expensive GPU infrastructure. A common problem is when new data (including new classes) are constantly added to an evolving, always-learning system. Algorithms to move towards real-time updates will be essential.   Extreme Deep Learning: Training IB neural networks efficiently The high model capacity of deep networks is why increasing amounts of data and model size improves performance. However, there are substantial challenges in hardware and algorithms challenges in training very large models efficiently. The aim is to address these challenges to achieve more efficient training   Deep Learning for Spoken Language Processing and Understanding: Towards better modeling of human communication Language technology has made great advances through deep learning in the past five years, penetrating fields such as speech recognition and machine translation. However, there are still numerous challenges that need to be addressed, ranging from the requirement of specialized linguistic resources to large amounts of annotated data, and to insufficient theoretical grounding in deep learning. This aim attempts to address challenges that are often overlooked by major commercial AI players.   White-Box Deep Learning: Towards interpretable and contextually informed models Current deep learning models are largely black-boxes that are not informed by contextual relations and provide little intuition. Improved abilities to regulate the learning process, and interpret the resulting predictions will be essential for the next wave of AI applications - especially for complex learning scenarios and applications involving critical decisions   Incorporating Knowledge Graphs into Deep Learning: Towards better understanding of Images Current deep learning systems today have no real understanding of images, with output typically a bunch of bounding boxes, learnt using a large number of label or sentence-level associations. Knowledge graphs like the MIT ConceptNet will be used to understand higher level semantics and relationships between entities, to improve classification accuracy.

responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHO ARE WE? Digimind is a leading social media intelligence SaaS company, based in NYC, Paris, Rabat, Singapore and Grenoble. We help brands and agencies drive customer experiences through best-in-breed social media listening and analytics technology to help them make better strategic decisions. We have an established international client base which includes Fortune 500 companies across a variety of sectors including technology, retail, pharmaceutical and financial services. We work over 200+ of the world's top companies, including Linkedin, Lexus, Deloitte, Intel, Disney, BBDO and GE. RESPONSIBILITIES: Digimind is looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our rapidly growing team in Singapore. Talented, dedicated and enthusiastic, your role will be to provide best-in-class customer experience to our clients by helping them achieve their goals. Responsibilities include but not limited to:  Managing client onboarding, delivery & implementation, and retention Managing a portfolio of strategic accounts from a wide range of industries Provide training, technical support and strategic recommendations to existing clients Working closely with Sales, Account Management, and Consulting to ensure customer goals are met and upsell potential is uncovered Very autonomous role as you will be the main point of contact for a large number of existing Digimind clients

A track record in leveraging design thinking, functional requirements definition, business process analysis, business modelling, and workshop design and facilitation to assess business issues and develop solutions Working knowledge of the full lifecycle of software development and the broad emerging technology ecosystem Strong business analysis experience    Ideally, you’ll also have  Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills Ability to work in a collaborative and client-facing environment Experience of working with or as part of a scrum team Advanced degrees relevant to digital delivery in emerging technology
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur EY Digital and Emerging Technology Practice is a team of creative and inspiring developers, designers and strategic thinkers that partner with our analytics, customer experience and functional advisory teams to generate real business outcomes for our clients through digital transformation.   About the opportunity Consultants at EY Digital are the engine room of our business, working on the front lines with our client, colleagues and third-parties to transform businesses. They work across industries and markets, cross-pollenating the best of digital, customer, strategy and technology to design, build and run the businesses of tomorrow. They traverse the digital spectrum from strategy and innovation, through to experience transformation and digitization of operations. No two days are the same. We are currently looking to hire motivated Senior Consultants and Managers into our growing Emerging Technology team. This team will help build and take to market our solutions across a range of technologies, including Robotic Process Automation, Machine Learning / AI and Blockchain. The Emerging Technology team works closely with EY’s functional experts in Finance, IT, HR, Supply Chain, Customer and Strategy, as well as with our sector teams across various industries, to design, develop and implement fit-for-purpose solutions for our clients.   Key Responsibilities:  Work with a range of clients, designing solutions which will deliver real business value, enabled by a broad range of emerging technologies Collaborate effectively across multiple parts of the EY and client businesses to deliver complex digital solutions Develop proposals and prototypes to help our clients understand how these solutions will be delivered and what impact they will have on their business Create thought leadership, demonstrations and other materials that articulate our point of view on emerging technologies to both clients and EY colleagues  Skills and Attributes for success  You have a passion for emerging technology and you enjoy building things You are like being near the business and get satisfaction from delivering tangible outcomes You enjoy communicating with people from various backgrounds and can simplify complex technical conversations to help your audience understand the key concepts and the value that will be delivered      What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now

requirements: RequirementsQualifications:  BA degree or equivalent and approximately 2-5 years of writing/editing experience; or a graduate in journalism, business, economics or finance, with 2 years of reporting and writing experience. Well-rounded communication skills. Works well in a team environment, focusing on collaboration. Self-driven, energetic and ambitious Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills Ability to multitask and work under tight deadlines  Kindly formally apply for the role online at our Careers Website at https://www.spglobal.com/careers where you can also learn more about our company and the benefits of working at S&P Global.  S&P Global Platts  At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with confidence. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.  S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence. For more information, visit www.platts.com. S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer committed to making all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status (including domestic partnerships and civil unions), sexual orientation, military veteran status, unemployment status, or other legally protected categories, subject to applicable law.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Role: This position creates real-time content and analysis of the regional APAC Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) markets as part of the global S&P Global Platts LNG team. The role is for a key team player in the Platts JKM price assessment group, based in Singapore.  The Impact: Develop Platts’ LNG price assessments in the APAC region. Maintain Platts' high journalistic standards as you produce well-written analysis of LNG markets supply and demand dynamics that meets Platts editorial guidelines.  The Career Opportunity: You will contribute to the development of the Platts JKM benchmarks and other spot LNG assessments. You will create analysis and other content about short- and long-term LNG market trends. You will gain exposure to the LNG industry and its pricing dynamics.  The Team / The Business: You will be in regular contact with the LNG regional leader in Singapore, along with other regional news, pricing and analytics teams. The global teams work together closely in an often fast-paced environment.  Your Skills: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience; 2-5 years of reporting/writing experience, preferably on commodity markets; good communication skills; ability to manage multiple deadlines; and strong English language skills.  Our Hiring Manager says: “The role’s focus is to cover one of the most exciting areas in energy markets – LNG – in the region with the fastest-developing price benchmark, JKM. The position offers the ability to be on the frontline of developing critical news and price assessments for our subscribers.”  Responsibilities:  Gathers commodity price information, produces price assessments/markets and writes daily market commentaries Writes daily LNG news and market analysis for Platts’ real-time alert services, websites and daily publications. That may include analyzing data and reporting on company and industry events. Produces regular well-written enterprise stories for various Platts publications. Expands depth of stories through research. Develops thorough line of questioning. Follows news strategy guidelines on readership needs. Establishes, maintains and nurtures key sources and maintains a source list that can be shared and leveraged across the organization. Develops knowledge of beat and related companies/market benchmarks. Develops diverse information sources (including documents; third tier sources etc.) and a strong ability to interpret information from various documents. Regional travel and public speaking opportunities.

job: Brand Measurement Lead, Reach Planning - Singapore
requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - 10 years of experience in consultative sales. - Experience with TV measurement tools. - Experience working with international brands, brand marketing, brand strategy and media planning in Southeast Asia Preferred qualifications: - Experience with strategically recommending multimedia solutions. - Strong presentation and communication skills and experience presenting to clients and stakeholders. At ease working in multicultural, cross-functional teams.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Large Customer Sales (LCS) Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build strong businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Additional Role Description: As a Brand Measurement Lead on Reach Planning, you will help drive product execution and rollout for all of Google’s Reach Planner product suites, in one of the fastest growing regions for YouTube. While you will be based out of Singapore, your work responsibilities with cover two markets in the Southeast Asia region. Your knowledge of online media and offline media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities will shape how new and existing business grows. You will shape and drive the integration of Google Reach Planner solutions with large agencies and customers to ensure that Google planning data is seamlessly available and usable by the advertising community. You will leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest brand and video products. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you will provide Google-caliber client service and product solutions. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach millions of users. Responsibilities: - Act as a regional expert on our products for brand measurement solution including YouTube and video advertising; provide deep product expertise to country Sales Specialist teams and pods so that they can provide branding solutions. - Launch commercialization; manage branding product launches/changes/betas in the region to ensure all dimensions of the product’s commercialization are fully operational, while working with a cross-functional team. - Enable deep integration of Google brand measurement tools within agency planning/strategy tools. - Gather regional sales feedback, identify brand sales issues and product gaps, conduct necessary analytics, prioritize and communicate to global video team and product managers as they develop the future product roadmap. Pitch large joint business plans, annual agreements and video incentive programs with large customers and their agencies. - Build capability for Google Reach Product and Solutions among country sales teams. Work closely with other market counterparts to ensure best practices and knowledge sharing for the overall Southeast Asia/Asia-Pacific Video Sales cluster.

We are in e-commerce, consumer research, advanced analytics and payments, and will lead the way with a mobile-led customer engagement platform that delivers value to merchants and consumers through the most relevant, dynamic, seamless, data rich, omni-channel experience; every day and at every stage of the consumer lifecycle.  To do this we've brought in a diverse set of talents from various industries and backgrounds to work with our pioneers for the next lap of our journey.  Responsibilities  ·       Define and implement architecture of the mobile application for NTUC group of social enterprise ·       Consume REST services created by the backend team.   ·       Design, build, and maintain high performance, reusable, and reliable code.   ·       Work close to the product team and be an active part of the product definition.
title: analytics

requirements: RequirementsRequirements   ·       4 years of experience in iOS.   ·       Experience consuming REST APIs.   ·       Solid knowledge in GIT and CI tools.   ·       Strong OOP background.   ·       Experience working in Agile teams.   ·       Have successfully launched mobile applications.

requirements: Requirements·      Min 6 years of experience in Java or other OOP languages.   ·       Deep knowledge in architectures based on microservices and design of Restful APIs.   ·       Experience developing complex components involving scalability, security, data access and distributed systems.  ·       Knowledge in Linux and SQL databases and NoSQL.   ·       Solid knowledge in GIT and CI tools.   ·       Strong OOP background.   ·       Experience working in Agile teams.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesNTUC Enterprise is part of NTUC’s Group of Social Enterprises, which has businesses in groceries, insurance, F&B, healthcare, education and malls. The group shares a collective vision to create better and more meaningful lives by complementing the lifestyle habits of Singaporeans.   Today, we have embarked on a transformation and innovation journey; re-organising and staffing up to become a dynamic, digital-enabled, data-driven organisation to go beyond loyalty and campaign management. requirements: RequirementsRequirements ▪ Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field. ▪ At least 8 years of relevant experience, including managing multivendor environments, working with on-premise and cloud systems, integrating SaaS products in the corporate setup. ▪ Fair level of technical competency in the areas of networking, operating systems, security, cloud technologies. ▪ Proven IT service management practitioner with strong project management expertise using both traditional and agile methodologies. ▪ Strong communication skills, including the ability to gather relevant data and information, actively listen, verbalize ideas effectively, and manage and resolve conflict. ▪ Excellent presentation and facilitation skills. ▪ Demonstrated expertise of building a consensus across business partners and technology leaders, as well as influencing successful outcomes. ▪ Good understanding of business process re-engineering or process improvement.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesNTUC Enterprise is part of NTUC’s Group of Social Enterprises, which has businesses in groceries, insurance, F&B, healthcare, education and malls. The group shares a collective vision to create better and more meaningful lives by complementing the lifestyle habits of Singaporeans.  Today, we have embarked on a transformation and innovation journey; re-organising and staffing up to become a dynamic, digital-enabled, data-driven organisation to go beyond loyalty and campaign management. We are in e-commerce, consumer research, advanced analytics and payments, and will lead the way with a mobile-led customer engagement platform that delivers value to merchants and consumers through the most relevant, dynamic, seamless, data rich, omni-channel experience; every day and at every stage of the consumer lifecycle. To do this we've brought in a diverse set of talents from various industries and backgrounds to work with our pioneers for the next lap of our journey. Job Description You will develop an actionable strategy and roadmap to transform the way NTUC social enterprises’ employees uses technology in their day-to-day jobs. You will lead a team, partnering internal and external stakeholders, to plan, deliver, operate and measure how your work impacts employee. The portfolio of digital workplace solutions and services includes messaging, collaboration, corporate applications, enterprise mobility, end user support. Your responsibility will be to ensure employees in all NTUC social enterprises can use those solutions effectively, securely, consistently to maximise their productivity and satisfaction. You will also establish, maintain and continuously enhance IT service management practices and processes to ensure operational consistency and reliability of the workplace solutions and services. The successful candidate will: ▪ Have a strong technical background, particularly in workplace technologies. ▪ Have successful history of implementing best-of-breed both commercial and open source technologies in a large enterprise with diverse infrastructure containing Windows, MacOS and Linux. ▪ Be accountable for defining group-wide workplace technology standards after thorough process of understanding prioritized business requirements and desired employee experiences. ▪ Have a history of proven collaboration, being able to create tight partnership with all stakeholders, derive a long-term vision in collaboration with stakeholders and able to influence peers and senior executives in order to operationalize a strategy. ▪ Have proven history of effective and inclusive leadership. ▪ Technical enough to participate in high-level technical design, strategy roadmap development and technical architecture for projects and/or programs. ▪ Be able to assess the compatibility and integration of products/services in order to ensure an integrated architecture across interdependent technologies. ▪ Have experience managing project budgets, scope and can conduct resource planning for risks that are proactively identified. ▪ Have practical experience in applying agile methodologies within and outside of software development projects.
title: analytics

job: Senior Manager Supply Chain Visibility, ASPAC
requirements: RequirementsQUALIFICATIONS  This position requires 7-10 years of relevant experience is required A BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience with advanced degree is required Experience executing projects with increasing exposure to large scale programs in the life sciences industry including manufacturing, supply chain and associated areas of the business PMI trained/certified and FPX training preferred MBA in project management or related areas is an advantage Experience with SAP in a manufacturing/distribution environment Strong understanding of supply chain processes. APICS (Association for Operations Management) certification is an advantage Experience with industry standards such as GS1 (Global Standards organization) is an advantage Given the global character and ASPAC regional ownership of this role, fluent knowledge of English is required Excellent analytical skills are required Excellent communication skills (written, oral and presentation) are required Must possess ability to develop relationships and inspire confidence and trust from internal and external partners at all levels Strong leadership skills with ability to engage and inspire global teams to deliver results within budget and defined timelines Knowledge of Supply Chain, Finance and the IT process is required; Knowledge of financial valuation techniques and inputs required and how to interpret valuation output required. Understanding of end-to-end Supply Chain interactions, interdependencies, and end-to-end business/IT architecture, is preferred. Ability to understand the cultural and change management requirements and impact inherent in a large, complex organizational change initiative. 'Big picture’ orientation with the ability to deliver at the tactical level an enterprise solution for the respective process area.  LOCATION / ORGANIZATION  Singapore
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Supply Chain Visibility team is part of the Strategy & Deployment organization within Johnson & Johnson Supply Chain. We provide end-to-end enterprise digital capabilities to enable connectivity across our supply chain in a compliant, effective and efficient way. The Supply Chain Visibility team is responsible for bridging the physical to our digital supply chain, delivering value by developing and leveraging our digital capabilities to engage with our customers, and shaping internal and external environments with our expertise. We work closely with different functions across Johnson & Johnson to enhance our customer experience.  ROLE OVERVIEW  Hands-on owner of regional deployment of enterprise supply chain visibility programs (e.g., Serialization, UDI etc.) including strategy, planning and execution Gathers business inputs and requirements, develops plans and executes all regional Supply Chain Visibility programs Works collaboratively with regional and global Pharma, Consumer and Med Devices business units and other stakeholders (e.g., IT, CLS ) to deploy regional programs Represents the Supply Chain Visibility programs within the local business, IT and CLS organizations Promotes development, utilization and expansion of new product identification, serialization and traceability capabilities to meet regulatory requirements Develops opportunities to leverage these capabilities to deliver value beyond compliance  SCOPE OF ROLE  Geographic Breadth – ASPAC regional (e.g., deployment) and Global (e.g., lead cross-regional projects) responsibility  Business Breadth – All segments (Pharma, Consumer and Med Devices), End-to-End SC functions (Plan, Source, Make, Deliver), IT, Master Data and Finance Levels of influence – peers, Directors and VPs  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Lead cross-functional and cross-segment teams in regional deployments of supply chain visibility programs and capabilities  Establish approach and detailed methodology and plans for all deployments Drive regional usage and alignment, country by country, to enterprise approach and design templates (e.g., adoption of GS1 standards, common label formats, standard repository) Ensure country specific project(s) scope progresses in line with the project charter Define business roles and engage / coordinate business resourcing including cross-functional Coordinate and provide business input to process design and requirements gathering (including KPIs) and user acceptance testing (scripts and test conduct) Establish an interface with Regulatory Affairs to assure all Project requirements are aligned with the regulatory demands across ASPAC countries Escalate business design issues for resolution Coordinate Business project efforts across multiple countries, projects and project work streams Contribute to program governance approach and drive business alignment to this approach Ensure integration of external manufacturers, internal sites, 3rd party logistic providers and customers by working collaboratively with designated Business / IT Project Managers, Subject Matter Experts and Stakeholders Act as liaison point with business QA, Change Management, Master Data, Global Tech Services, Labeling, and Regulatory to ensure appropriate involvement Aid the development of cost estimates; managing assigned budget and provide tracking of actual expenditures to plan Drive analytics and scenario planning analysis, linked to above Support global leadership team in activities related to global strategy, tactical actions and financial management  Lead global initiatives for capability building, infrastructure assessment, technology upgrades, process mapping and data flows Develop playbook for on-going deployments and sharing best practices Define and develop ideas, both internal to J&J and with external partners, for driving value beyond compliance  Represent JJSC in regulatory and industry forums to influence regional thinking and agenda
title: analytics

requirements: Requirements ~ Analyse data for business insights identification. ~ Analyse production efficiencies. ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions. ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield. ~ Develop On-the-job training programme. ~ Develop workplace learning plan. ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise. ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans. ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement. ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling. ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance. ~ Lead change management in the organisation. ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources. ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation. ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks. ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity. ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes. ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.

responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a MCT CPEE Max Out Program Engineer, you are to support the Max Out Program Manager in Project Management, liasion with Sites on program prioritites and support needed, drive Network BKM fan out and alignment. strategy, priorities, and how they relate to company goals •Lead global, cross-functional task force teams (TFTs) or enabling projects that support Max Out program priorities across the Network and drive accountability through clear communication, informal feedback, effective project management and appropriate use of metrics •Drive continuous improvement of Network Constraint Workstations to BIC performance through, •Benchmarking and analyze Network performance •WPD •Utilization •MA •Lost Time •Standby Time •RPT •Utilize Data Analytics tools to identify tool bottlenecks, hidden factories and productivity loss •Partner with POs and TOs in the identification of opportunities for improvement in workstation performance                     PROJECT MANAGEMENT •Drive technical activity on assigned project on daily basis •Ensure assigned project has appropriate Stakeholders, and deliverables and schedule •Ensure assigned project is progressing on schedule •Identify and mitigate risks and issue which may impact the project •Escalate to project Sponsor when necessary •Provide or support (Program Manager) regular updates to Sponsor and key Stakeholders on current status, risks and issues as needed   SITE AND REGIONAL LIASION •Collaborate within the Site/Region to achieve Site’s objective and goals •Conduct regular 1 on 1s with Site/Region stakeholders to understand site priorities, challenges and support needed •Communicate to Site/Region stakeholders on program priorities, roadmap and any program related changes •Provide or support (Program Manager) regular updates to Site/Region leadership team and stakeholders on Network activities, programs, issues, projects, wins or other items that are necessary •Promote Network communication   NETWORK BKM FAN OUT AND ALIGNMENT •Identify Site BKMs and communicate to Peer Group •Identify Site BKM implementation gap and provide information to Site’s stakeholders •Collaborate with Site’s stakeholders to develop implementation roadmap for applicable BKMs •Support in updating Network BKM heatmap and implementation matrix •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular update to SLT on BKM implementation status COMMUNICATION •Work closely with Program Manager to understand program charter, roadmap and priorities •Facilitate 2 way communication between Site and Program Manager •Provide regular updates to Sponsor and key Stakeholders on current status, risks and issues •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular 1 on 1s with Site’s stakeholders to understand site priorities, challenges, support needed. •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular communication to Site’s stakeholders on program priorities, roadmap and any program related changes •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular updates to Site leadership team and stakeholders on Network activities, programs, issues, projects, wins or other items that are necessary •Conduct or support (Program Manager) regular update to SLT on BKM implementation status

job: Associates - Valuation, Modeling & Economics (Data Analytics), TAS
requirements: RequirementsYour key responsibilities  Have a primary focus on data analytics in our decision support and business modelling services Serve as a member of a cross functional team contributing at each phase of the engagement lifecycle Demonstrate high levels of technical and professional knowledge and quickly assimilate new knowledge Proactively contribute as part of the engagement team that partners with client finance and operational professionals Identify issues, propose both strategies and technical approaches and deliver value-adding insights Have the ability to balance technical skills with project management and strong business acumen Maintain and develop positive, productive and professional relationships with clients Commit to developing knowledge, continue to learn and share knowledge with clients and other EY team members Stay abreast of current technology, business and economic developments relevant to our services and client's business    Skills and attributes for success    Ability to bring data analytics capabilities to a traditionally financially focused role, combine their proven experience in data analytics with an understanding of corporate transaction and/or general business acumen.   Appreciation of the key questions that clients may need answered to ensure a transparent, information rich decision making process.     Effectively communicate ideas and findings to a wide variety of stakeholders.   Be intellectually curious and committed to constantly improving their own skills.   Leaders with the ability to quickly anticipate and respond to the issues of constantly changing global economy.     To qualify for the role you must have   A bachelor's degree/master's degree and up to least 1 years of experience in developing descriptive and predictive analytics solutions    Degree in mathematics/statistics or data science  Strong data analysis skills including the ability to identify, extract, manipulate and use statistical methods to analyze large data sets Experience in use of statistical software packages (SAS, SPSS, R) and/or experience in visualization applications (Spotfire, Tableau, PowerView). Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required and some level of VBA knowledge is also preferred but not essential to the role Experience with packages and development environments is highly advantageous but not essential; including simulation products (e.g. Witness, Simul8), optimisation products (CPlex, Xpress-MP) or programming environments (VB.net) Excellent analytical, communication, teamwork and interpersonal skills Capabilities in MS Word and PowerPoint are required Further studies in business or data science fields may also be beneficial to the role This role may also suit candidates with professional experiences in consulting, investment or commercial banking, strategy, venture capital or financial research who are looking to focus on transaction analytics    Ideally, you also have   Experience (work and/or study) in a data science related field with an interest in business or financial transactions.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur Transaction Advisory Services (TAS) team works with clients to manage their capital agenda to drive competitive advantage and increased returns. As part of a global team of 10,000 professionals in 100 countries you will advise clients on preserving, optimising, raising or investing capital. Major groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines and competencies) within TAS include Mergers and Acquisition Services, Project Finance, Restructuring Services, Operational Transaction Services, Transaction Support, Transaction Tax, and Valuation, Modeling & Economics. Join Valuation, Modelling & Economics and you join a team of experienced professionals who bring to clients excellence in accounting, taxation and financial due diligence. You will help guide clients through the model review, model support and model-build activities necessary to make key decisions and improve strategic outcomes. With over 1,600 valuation professionals worldwide, no similarly positioned global professional organisation can match our breadth of capabilities or our depth of resources.   The opportunity We currently have career opportunity for Associates specializing in Data Analytics to join our talented Business Modelling group within Transaction Advisory Services in Singapore. We work across all industries and operate in a broad range of disciplines including:  Decision support Data analytics and visualisation Simulation and optimization (Operational Research) Transaction evaluation Strategic planning and capital allocation Business case development Budgeting, forecasting and planning Other bespoke model development

requirements: RequirementsEducation/Experience - Degree preferably in Finance, Economics, and/or quantitative subjects. - Professional certification such as FRM, CPA, CFA will be advantageous. - 8+ years of experience in international banking with specific focus on Liquidity Risk Management, Stress tests & ALM quantitative methods. Skills - Knowledge of financial markets and products. - In-depth understanding of risk methodologies, interest rate modelling, VAR, and/or other complex financial risk modelling. - Strong understanding of operational risks across the full product/processes range found in banks. - Ability to work independently on multiple tasks/projects. - Excellent oral and written communication skills in English. - Adequate knowledge of IT systems/applications. - Proficiency in risk concepts, banking products/operations/systems, pertinent regulatory requirements, International Accounting Standards and related pronouncements, including related best practices. - Self-motivated, an eye for details. - A flexible team player and able to work under pressure. Knowledge - Solid experience in market risk and liquidity risk management as well as excellent understanding of Asset-Liability management. - Possess superior knowledge of operational risk management techniques and methodologies. Other - Ensure high standards of confidentialtiy and ethics to safeguard commercially sensitive information. - Has the ability to plan, develop and implement short and long term goals. - Can work independently but at the same time could be a strong team contributor.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Summary: The candidate will have specialised experience and technical capability to deliver an end-to-end control framework along with advanced analytics to market risk activities, ALM modelling, Liquidity Risk, Economic Capital and related functional/operational capacity. The candidate will also be responsible for the adequacy and effectiveness of the operational risk management, techniques/processes.  To provide hands-on support and relevant solutions for effective operation of data management, MIS, analytics evaluations and other support required for Group Risk Committee and actively support the Head of Risk in Group Risk Projects and initiatives.  Duties and Responsibilities: A. Shareholder & Financial - Assist in the management of fundamental prudential risks of the Bank, counterparty, leverage, liquidity, interest rate, currency and other market risks. - Support in the oversight and formulation of advice to the Branch on the current risk exposures of the Bank and future risk strategy, including strategy for capital and liquidity management with due consideration to the current and prospective macroeconomic and financial environment. - Implement Operational Risk Management Framework (ORMF) that covers the Group's level of operational risk appetite and tolerance. B. Customers (Internal & External) - Coordinate with Compliance department to obtain updates on regulatory changes pertaining to risk to assess their impact on the Group's different operational/portfolio risk profiles. - Build and maintain strong and effective relationships with inter-departments and units to achieve the Bank's goals/objectives. - Support the Head of Risk to provide timely and accurate risk information to Risk & Management Committees, internal & external auditors and the Compliance function when required. C. Internal (Processes, Products, Regulatory)  Relative to Market Risk Portfolio, ALM & Liquidity Risk Management; - Review and propose necessary changes to the existing portfolio management techniques and procedures for the domestic and overseas business in light of changing market conditions based on Basel Committee recommendations/other best practices and QCB or any host regulator regulations and guidelines to ensure that a sound environment for identifying, assessing, measuring, monitoring and controlling Risk is in place. - Leverage on the necessary tools, systems and MIS reports for monitoring of limits that relate to borrowers, counterparties, cross-border Group entities and more specifically excess over limit, expired limits/facilities, classification of advances per credit rating criteria, related party exposure and credit concentration, liquidity monitoring and related market risk exposures. - Support for correction of any weaknesses, identified during assessments, audits, or examinations by internal/external audit staff, Group Compliance personnel, regulators examiners or Sharia's auditors as applicable.  - Assist in implementing risk policy & controls that ensure transactions are carried out in accordance with approved policies/limits and in compliance with regulatory and legal requirements. - Promote the integrity of business continuity principles, methodology and strategy through the development, implementation and ongoing management of BCM. - Ensure the preparation of concise and informative risk information MIS reports. - Strengthen internal control through more effective and efficient entity-level controls. - Implement tools for identification and assessment of operational risk such as Self Risk Assessment, Risk Mapping, Risk Indicators, construction/maintenance of an Operational Loss Database.

requirements: RequirementsRequirements  Min. Diploma/ Degree in Mass Communication or its equivalent 3-5 years relevant experience Fast paced work environment Team player with positive attitude Excellent command of English and project management
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description Overview This is a vital role for Iris Singapore and APAC, and one that can go as far as your ambition. We have a multi-disciplinary team working on these accounts – with a Business Director, Concise Analysts (our business, data and analytics consultancy), design, creative and account managers all working together to manage our best-in-class offering. We are looking for a Planning lead on the account to lead the strategic vision of the account, answer briefs and challenge clients. You will lead senior client relationships, building an environment of challenge and trust so we can generate the best work we ever have on the account. The role will require passion, insight, flexibility, strategic and entrepreneurial thinking, pragmatism and a drive for excellence. You bring your experience, enthusiasm, hunger for greatness, can-do attitude and energy to the table and we’ll all get along mighty fine. Responsibilities  Working with the Business Director, and other team members and planners on Personal Health campaign briefs. Push our digital responses to new creative heights. Thinking beyond video content, and being more innovative and challenging in our responses - what about search, reviews, UX to help achieve the client’s objectives? Work with Iris Concise (our business, data and analytics arm) as necessary to use data to power our strategies. Identify which briefs are ones we can push for creative greatness, and ones which we deal with efficiently and professionally. Working on new business pitches that require innovative, cutting edge relationship thinking, alongside the senior leaders of the business. To lead proactive client initiatives, to keep our clients inspired, motivated and seeing Iris as a valued and trusted partner. Working with creative leaders in Singapore to ensure we are briefing, inspiring and pushing creative to new heights. Work with the team to lead a measurement agenda to ensure that our work get the recognition it deserves from our peers for its effectiveness and creativity.

job: Manager / Senior Manager, Financial Services -Corporate Finance Strategy, TAS
requirements: RequirementsSkills and attributes for success  Project Management - be part of project teams comprising colleagues from across the TAS sub service lines Business and Commercially Driven – working in a fast-paced, exciting environment with  strong business acumen to drive value to our clients Business Development - assist in aspects of pursuits, including presentations and client meetings.  Contribute to our practice development initiatives, supporting the continued focus on our team as a great place to work Learning - Learn and develop technical and personal skills to support achievement of career goals, through a blend of structured learning, coaching and experiences Building Relationships - Strong working relationships with senior clients, including influence, advice and support to key decision makers    To qualify for the role you must have  A bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or any related discipline At least 5 years (for manager level)/ 8 years (for senior manager level) of relevant experience  Experience in leading strategy/consulting engagements for global strategy firms or Big 4 strategy teams Ability to independently lead consulting workstreams (Manager) or whole engagements (Senior Manager) Some experience in financial services of any kind (banking, insurance, payments, bancassurance, fintec, alternative currencies...) Some exposure to transactions, M&A, or private equity, either in-house or as part of a consulting team Experience and skills in technology are not necessary but interesting: anything related to data, analytics, programming and data modelling languages Experience developing client relationships (Senior Manager level) emerging markets exposure, ideally including key Asian markets Asian language skills - especially ASEAN languages or Chinese A high degree of cross-cultural sensitivity A high degree of resourcefulness, drive, and ambition Tolerance for extensive travel    Ideally, you also have  A proven record of excellence in a merger integration, acquisitions, divestitures, carve outs Established networking skills in a relevant industry    What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident leader equipped with strong people management skills and a genuine passion to make things happen in a dynamic organization.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are the only professional services organization who has a separate business dedicated exclusively to the financial services marketplace. Join Financial Services (FSO) and you will work with multi-disciplinary teams from around the world to deliver a global perspective. Aligned to key industry groups including asset management, banking and capital markets, insurance and private equity, we provide integrated advisory, assurance, tax, and transaction services. Through diverse experiences, world-class learning and individually tailored coaching you will experience ongoing professional development. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.      The opportunity Our Financial Services - Transaction Advisory Services group is seeking to recruit experienced professionals into our developing Corporate Finance Strategy practice. Joining us will provide individuals with fantastic opportunities to build on their current transaction and commercial experience, and work on a number of diverse and demanding projects as part of a growing practice area. We continue to invest heavily in growing our geographical footprint as well as our account coverage and execution capability, as well as developing new areas of capability. Increasing globalisation of our Financial Services business means that we work closely with colleagues in both Asia-Pacific and the Americas in respect of serving our largest global accounts as well as delivering cross-border engagements. Our clients including leading global companies across the Insurance, Banking & Capital Markets and Asset Management industries as well as private equity, central banks and Governments. Our assignments are typically complex, integrated projects that frequently involve working with colleagues across a variety of disciplines, as well as other professional advisers. To leverage our already strong credentials, and to strengthen our ability to provide front-end strategic advice to our clients, we are building a dedicated Financial Services commercial diligence and strategy capability to complement our financial and operational diligence, M&A, valuations and business modelling services.   Your key responsibilities As a Manager / Senior Manager in the team, you'll deliver strategic consulting engagements for clients throughout Asia, on topics such as  corporate strategy, digital strategy, business unit strategy, analytics, transaction strategy, M&A, commercial due diligence, organisational design, partnership/JV negotiation and formation developing new clients through proposals/pitches developing, mentoring, recruiting team members creating and contributing to the firm's intellectual property base  You'll work in a fast paced, highly dynamic and entrepreneurial work environment and have opportunity to expose to cutting edge topics and a vast range of clients and project types

job: Senior Manager, People Advisory Services, Advisory, Singapore
requirements: RequirementsAbout you   In your role as a PAS Senior Manager, you’ll:  Support clients in their transformation journey through the design and implementation of effective organizational change management programs Help clients deliver human capital strategies and workforce optimization programs imperative in an organization’s success Work with Business Leaders on organization restructuring efforts, workforce planning, competency modelling, performance and rewards management Work with Business Leaders on improving the effectiveness and efficiency of the HR function Be part of the overall growth of the Advisory Practice in the ASEAN region    We’re looking for people with the following experience:  Degree in Business, Commerce, Human Resources Management and/or other relevant disciplines At least 8 years of working experience with 6 years in a client facing consulting role. Possess experience in areas such as HR operating and delivery models, HR process improvements, capability development, organizational development as well as change management (leadership alignment stakeholder engagement, cultural alignment, communications) Delivered projects in manpower planning, competency modelling, performance management, rewards strategy design and organization re-structuring Proven ability to build valued relationships with clients Passion to create a positive learning culture, to coach and develop team members Good communications skills, especially fluent in written and spoken English.    About us   EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.   Interested?  You know what your goals are. We want to help you reach them. This is why our goal is to challenge you with opportunities that utilise your unique talents, interests and skills. Building on your strengths is just one more way we build a better working world. Our goal is to help you achieve yours. Create the career you want and apply today.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPeople Advisory Services (PAS) shapes and delivers the part of business strategy that depends on people. As a PAS professional, you will have the opportunity to work with global clients to understand and address some of their largest and most complex people-related challenges, and ultimately improve and drive valuable and sustainable business results. We focus on engagements that relates to performance, talent, systems, reward, mobility and analytics.   We believe that you should own and shape your career. But we’ll provide the support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed. The strength of our global network, combined with local empowerment and a relentless focus on winning in specific markets, means you’ll get to interact and team with individuals from various geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   About the opportunity  As part of PAS team, you’ll work with leading organisations to help them get the most out of their people.  You’ll use your knowledge and experience to help clients improve operational efficiencies.  Your commercial capabilities will grow as you drive projects lead high profile engagements. With access to talented leaders, formal learning and a wide variety of practical experience, you’ll receive all the support you need to succeed.  In PAS team, we help our clients with:  Performance - effectively manage change through developing innovative,digitally centric behavior led strategies to support clients through the transformation. This could be for operating model changes, digital / technology change and M&A HR Transformation – including all elements from the design HR operating models including shared services, center of excellence, organization design, incorporating new HR digital technologies and the overall improvement of HR process efficiency.  Talent optimization - Develop data supported workforce strategies and employee value propositions, manage talent, address people risk, develop capability at all levels, and focus on organizational development activities including culture change.

And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.     Interested?   You know what your goals are. We want to help you reach them. This is why our goal is to challenge you with opportunities that utilise your unique talents, interests and skills. Building on your strengths is just one more way we build a better working world. Our goal is to help you achieve yours. Create the career you want and apply today.
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPeople Advisory Services (PAS) shapes and delivers the part of business strategy that depends on people. As a PAS professional, you will have the opportunity to work with global clients to understand and address some of their largest and most complex people-related challenges, and ultimately improve and drive valuable and sustainable business results. We focus on engagements that relates to performance, talent, systems, reward, mobility and analytics.       We believe that you should own and shape your career. But we’ll provide the support and opportunities to develop the skills, knowledge and experience to succeed. The strength of our global network, combined with local empowerment and a relentless focus on winning in specific markets, means you’ll get to interact and team with individuals from various geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.       About the opportunity   As part of PAS team, you’ll work with leading organisations to help them get the most out of their people.  You’ll use your knowledge and experience to help clients improve operational efficiencies.  Your commercial capabilities will grow as you drive projects lead high profile engagements. With access to talented leaders, formal learning and a wide variety of practical experience, you’ll receive all the support you need to succeed.    In PAS team, we help our clients with:   Performance - effectively manage change through developing innovative,digitally centric behavior led strategies to support clients through the transformation. This could be for operating model changes, digital / technology change and M&A. HR Transformation – including all elements from the design HR operating models including shared services, center of excellence, organization design, incorporating new HR digital technologies and the overall improvement of HR process efficiency.  Talent optimization - Develop data supported workforce strategies and employee value propositions, manage talent, address people risk, develop capability at all levels, and focus on organizational development activities including culture change.
title: analytics
