job: School of Management and Communication - Lecturer (Consumer Behaviour and Research)
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities Facilitate student learning, conduct student-industry collaboration project, develop curricula and/or contribute in various areas(s) such as :• Digital Marketing & E-commerce• Market Research• Business Statistics• Data Analytics & Visualisation• Consumer Psychology• Staff may also be required to take on the role as a mentor to students, and/or advise students on student life activities/developmental activities Requirements • Possess a degree, preferably in the relevant field(s)• Preferably with at least 5 years of relevant industry experience• Experience in market research, digital marketing, e-commerce OR experience in managing data analytics preferred • Proficient in analytics software for business strategies would be an advantage• Self-motivated and enjoy interaction with youths• Has strong industry linkages with consumer brand owners, digital marketing agencies and related field will be an advantage

responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities Facilitate student learning, develop curricula, deliver enrichment and professional development activities, and/or provide project supervision in the following areas:• Career Development Counselling / Coaching• Diversity• Employee Relations• HR Analytics• I-O Psychology• International Staff Management• Jobs and Labour Market• Labour Laws and Industrial Relations• Manpower Planning• Organisational Health and Culture Building • Performance Management• Positive Psychology• Psychometric Assessments• Rewards Management• Workplace Counselling and Communication Requirements• Possess a degree, preferably in the relevant field(s)• Preferably with at least 5 years of relevant industry experience• Possess sound planning, organising and multi-tasking skills, with a strong sense of responsibility for completing assigned duties on time• Have a passion for and be committed to developing talents• Have strong industry linkages to facilitate students in carrying out HR related projects

job: School of Engineering - Lecturer (Common Engineering Programme)
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities• Facilitate student learning and develop curriculum, primarily in areas of Mathematics• Duties also include supervising student final year projects, soliciting and supervising student internship and reaching out to various stakeholders such as secondary school students, teachers, parents and universities• Selected candidates are also expected to develop and conduct Continuing Education and Training (CET) classes and take part in R&D/Implementation projects Requirements• Relevant degree in Engineering field or relevant disciplines with at least 2 years of industry experience• Strong interest in development of Mathematics curriculum• Technically competent and have a passion for educating the youth• Experience in using Data Analytics• Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong working relationships with management and employees• Sound planning and organising skills, with a strong sense of responsibility for completing assigned duties on time

industry: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
job: Office of Student and Graduate Affairs - Administration (Procurement) – Senior Executive / Executive
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities The successful job applicant will contribute to the overall procurement, web functions and administrative support of OSG at Republic Polytechnic.• Process purchase requests in GEBIZ Portal and attend to procurement issues so that purchases comply with RP’s and Government IM Guidelines• Monitor Purchase Orders (POs) for department and liaise with requestors to close all Open POs by end of the government financial period• Monitor Period Contracts to ensure utilisation, timely renewal or work with staff to raise new quotation/tender• Identify potential procurement lapses and conduct training/clinic sessions for department on procurement• Support department’s web functions (when needed)• Provide administrative support for the team (e.g. minute taking, department meetings, retreat etc.)• Assist and support in OSG wide events and any other assigned administrative duties Requirements • Relevant academic qualifications with at least 3 years of related working experience (those with prior working experience in government sectors would be an advantage)• Those who are familiar with data analytics would be preferred• Must be proficient in Microsoft Office (e.g. Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint)• Must be matured and able to multi-task under pressure and detail-oriented with good communication and writing skills• Excellent team player and able to work with minimum supervision

industry: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
job: Office of Information Services - Manager  /  Deputy Manager (Learning Application Development)
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities - Establish and track project plans, milestones and deliverables in consultation with all stakeholders - Strategize, design and manage the execution of effective development frameworks (including plans, processes, etc.) for software / application, using industry standards of best practices and methodologies - Work closely with users to translate teaching and learning functional specifications into technical requirements and systems - Work closely with vendors to design, configure, develop and manage the development of systems for teaching and learning - Work closely with the relevant departments on the test procedures at various test stages of the applications - Understand and collate business data and reporting requirements. Translate the requirements into user specifications. - Design and streamline the business data model; Develop dashboards and reports to support the analytical capabilities Requirements - Relevant qualification in Learning Design, Information Technology or equivalent - Familiar with online course design, course delivery and various pedagogies - Experience in the various learning tools in the education market like Learning Management Systems, Learning Activity Management Systems, Learning Analytics, eResource Systems, Assessment Systems etc - Able to identify appropriate uses of emerging web and mobile technologies within a variety of educational settings - 2 to 8 years of experience in implementing and managing learning systems and applications in higher education - Experience in any of the programming languages - .net, java, HTML5, open source and other programming languages - Strong project management skills with technical competencies - Excellent communication (both oral and written) skills - Excellent analytical and problem solving skills - A resourceful, independent, self-starter and team player - Keenness for data mining and analysis, with good understanding of incepting and delivering high quality analytical reports - Experience with Business Analytical Tools (Tableau, Power BI etc)

job: School of Engineering - Lecturer (Engineering Design with Business)
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities• Facilitate student learning, develop curriculum and participate in development projects in Mobile App development, Product design, Data analytics and Automation• Duties also include mentoring students, supervising final year projects, soliciting and supervising student internship and reaching out to various stakeholders such as secondary school students, teachers, parents, industry partners and universities• Selected candidates are also expected to conduct Continuing Education and Training (CET) classes, propose and take part in applied research projects and provide consultancy services to the industry Requirements• Qualification in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Electrical / Electronic Engineering. Masters and PhD degree holders in the related fields are welcome• Relevant working experience in software programming, Android or IOS app development, electronic fabrication.• Familiar with practices across different domain from Mobile App programming, Unity Programming, 3D Printing and Rapid Prototyping and product design• Proficiency in Internet of Things, start-up and business operations will be a plus• Genuine interest and passion to share knowledge and interact with youths• Strong communication and interpersonal skills

job: School of Technology for the Arts - Lecturer (Media Production and Design)
responsibilities: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Responsibilities Lecturer will:   Deliver classes, develop curriculum, manage projects, plan, and deliver enrichment activities, and perform mentoring duties Develop, and deliver AT LEAST TWO modules from the following list:  Visual Communication Screenwriting Video Production Web Design (including web authoring tools) Multi-Platform Storytelling Branded Digital Storytelling   Supervise students in portfolio development, final year projects, and internships Take on the role of a mentor to students Build industry relations and networks (with local and global industry partners) Develop and delivery Continuing Education and Training (CET) courses when required Academic administration, events management, conduct of outreach programmes, and representing roles in selected working committees Take on other complementary programme development activities as tasked by the Programme Chair  Requirements   A Bachelor’s degree preferably in the field of Communication and Digital Media A minimum of three years industry experience, preferably in a related field. Teaching experience is an added advantage Must have experience in any of, or a combination of the following areas:  Scriptwriting/Screenwriting Digital Video Production Adobe Creative Cloud applications Mobile Web Application Design Responsive User Experiences Design Management and Integration Web Analytics   Ability to work independently as well as in a team Ability to work within tight deadlines Ability to communicate well with students of diverse academic, socioeconomic, and cultural backgrounds  Additional Advantages:  Strong administrative skills Strong IT skills Knowledgeable in HTML 5, CSS3, JavaScript, Responsive Grid Layout Skills in motion graphics animation and visual effects for post-production Ability to teach one or more of the following modules:  Multi-Platform Storytelling Interactive Media and Content Development Screenwriting Multi-Channel Content Marketing Graphic Design
